title: Earth observation camera maker raises $15 million for European expansion
key_assets: ['system assembly facilities in Europe', 'higher-resolution cubesat products', 'xScape100 product range', 'short-wave infrared camera technology', 'AI-enabled camera control electronics']
summary: Simera Sense, a Belgian camera maker specializing in Earth observation payloads, has raised nearly $15 million in a funding round led by NewSpace Capital and backed by Knife Capital. The funds will be used to expand production capacity in Europe, develop higher-resolution products, and grow its development team. The company collaborates with European satellite manufacturers and supports ESA's Phi-Sat-2 mission.
why_it_matters: The funding enables Simera Sense to scale production and accelerate the development of advanced Earth observation technologies, supporting the growing demand for high-resolution satellite imagery and AI-enabled data processing in space.
